spoken_words: Hold on, I'll check. Mike Rotch. Mike Rotch. Hey, has anybody seen Mike Rotch, lately?
Listen you little puke. One of these days I'm gonna catch you, and I'm gonna carve my name on your back with an ice pick.
What's the matter, Homer? The depressin' effects of alcohol usually don't kick in 'til closing time.
Moe's Tavern. Hold on, I'll check. ... Hey everybody! I'm a stupid moron with an ugly face and a big butt, and my butt smells, and I like to kiss my own butt.
Come on, Jer. Open up. Be a pal. Remember when I pulled you and your wife out of that burning car?
Ah, business is slow. People today are healthier and drinking less. You know, if it wasn't for the Junior High school next door no one would even use the cigarette machine.
Increased job satisfaction and family togetherness are poison for a purveyor of mind-numbing intoxicants like myself.
Yeah, I know, I got behind on my beer payments. The distributor cut me off and I spent my last ten grand on the "Love Tester".

Moe! It's called a "Flaming Moe"! That's right, a "Flaming Moe". My name is Moe, and I invented it. That's why it's called a Flaming Moe. What? What are you lookin' at, Homer? It's a Flaming Moe I'm Moe.
Oh great! Why don't we fill out an application? I'll need your name, measurements and turn ons..
No dice. The "Flaming Moe" is not for sale. Do you know how much of my blood and sweat are in this drink?
Ladies and gentlemen, some new buddies of mine stopped by tonight. Maybe we can get 'em to come up here. How about a warm "Flaming Moe's" welcome for Aerosmith!
Well, it's hard to say. He may have come up with the recipe, but I came up with the idea of charging six ninety-five for it.
Hold on. I'll check. Hugh Jass, Oh, somebody check the men's room for a Hugh Jass.
Alright, alright. I'll split the million with Homer. Jeepers, Mary and Joseph. I sleep with a chick once, it costs me a half a million bananas.
Ah, she left to pursue a movie career. Frankly I think she was better off here.
Ah, yeah. Just a minute, I'll check. Uh, Bee O'Problem. Bee O'Problem. C'mon, guys. Do I have an O'Problem here?
Listen you, when I get a hold of you, I'm gonna use your head for a bucket and paint my house with your brains!
Bet you get into all kinds of trouble he don't even know about. Am I right? Huh? Am I right?
That's great! Hey, would you sing that old song you used to sing for me?
I think I can provide that service. Um, uh, Chief Wiggum, could you hand me that little black book?
Gotcha, fifty beans on Miami. Um, Homer, I got a call on the other line. Hello?
Sorry, Homer, you can't take any more of my money. I'm, uh, outta the bookie business.
Fudd? I thought they took that off the market after all those hillbillies went blind.
Hey, just a sec, I'll check. Amanda Huggenkiss! Hey, I'm looking for Amanda Huggenkiss! Why can't I find Amanda Huggenkiss!
You little S.O.B., if I ever find out who you are I'm gonna shove a sausage down your throat and stick starving dogs in your butt!
I wasn't really gonna kill ya'. I was just gonna cut ya! Aah, forget it. Ouch, I better go check on Barney.
Ivana Tinkle. Just a sec. Ivana Tinkle. Ivana Tinkle. All right, everybody put down your glasses. Ivana Tinkle.
Ah, they shouldn't have been there in the first place. But Homer is a real hero.
Well, well look who it is. Mr. "I don't need alcohol to enjoy life." We hate him, right fellas?
It does. We had thirty thousand here last night. Now play. The audience is gettin' restless.
What?... What am I lookin' at? I don't see nothin'. I'm gonna stop looking soon... What... what, is that it?
Oyster shells, hand painted to resemble Lucille Ball! You'll love Oyster Lucy! Oh Mr. Mooney, I just gotta meet Bob Cummings. Vivvv!!!
You know, you really irritate me, Skinner. What with your store-bought haircut and excellent posture.
If this gets out, the next words you say will be muffled by your own butt.
Are you talkin' to me? There's no one else here. You must be talkin' to me.
Uh, Freddy Quimby was with me the entire night in question. We were collecting canned goods for the starving people in, ah... you know, one of them loser countries.
Come to papa... Wait a minute! You have a straight flush, Homer. Go! You do this every time. You... oh, you, ah, ... I'm choking on my own rage here.
All right, here's the four one one, folks. Say some gangsta is dissin' your fly girl. You just give him one of these.
Hey, Homer, why don't you just nibble her elbow. That always melts her butter, right?
Oh, hi-hi, Marge. I heard you and Homer broke up so, um, I'm declaring my intentions to move in on his territory. Here, I uh, brung you some posies.
Geez, I come here, I get dressed up all nice-like, put my heart on the line and I make a fool of myself Oh boy, I'm gonna start bawling, here.
I uh, well... I never touched her, Homer. Homer, I swear, I never touched her.
I didn't ask her for no water. She's lying, Homer, she's lyin'. She told me you were dead. That's the only reason I... I didn't do nothin'!

Lemme check. Phone call for Al, Al Caholic. / Uh, Jacques Strap! / Is I Pee Freely here? / Hey, is there a Butts here? Seymour Butts? Uh, Homer Sexual / My Crotch / A Amanda Huggenkiss? / A Huge Ass / "Ivanna Tinkle" / I'm a stupid moron with an ugly face and a big butt, and my butt smells, and I like to kiss my own butt.
Aw, geez... really ya think so? All right, give 'em back. Come on, everybody give 'em back.
Oh, I'm happy. I'm very happy. La, la, la, la, la, la, la. See? Now waste your family and I'll give you a beer!
Homer, it's Moe. Ah, look, some of the ghouls and I are a little concerned the project isn't moving forward.
It's not so bad, Homer. They go in through your nose. And they let you keep the piece of brain they cut out.
What? What? A bartender can't come by and say "hi" to his best customer? Hey, hey there, Midge! Oh gee I like what you done to your hair.
And how are the little kids doin'? I mean really how are they doin'. Any disabling injuries? Something, say, that the gambling community might not yet know about? Come here, let me see those knees.
But Blanche! You gotta help me out here. Please! I'm sixty-four grand in the hole. They're gonna take my thumbs!
How can you judge this man, without talking to the people who know him best. We got the real dirt on Homer Simpson, and the biddin' starts at ten G's.
Ow! Ow! Ooh! Ow! A snake in the cash register. Great prank, fellas, great. Oh, I'm gonna be sick tonight.
I'm burnin' up, here. Ooh, ooh, taking advantage of my alcohol soaked clothes. It's funny and it makes you think.
Sorry, Homer. You should have thought of that before you gave me the old sugar-me-do. I'm taking your caricature down from Mt. Lushmore.
Of this chapter. There are chapters all over the world. And it has been foretold that someday a Chosen One will...
And it will need somebody to dispense drinks, i.e. me. Um, and someone will have to run the power. Uh, you can do that, Homer.
Hey, I got an idea. We can play a game to pass the time. Uh, I'll make the sound of a barnyard animal, and uh, you all try to guess what it is.
Sure, Homer, I can loan you all the money you need. However since you have no collateral, I'm gonna have to break your legs in advance.
Hey, hey! Are you a loan shark? Do you understand how finance works? Now let's do this thing.
MONEY GETS YOU ONE MORE ROUND/ DRINK IT DOWN/ YA STUPID CLOWN/ MONEY GETS YOU ONE MORE ROUND/ THEN YOU'RE OUT ON YOUR ASS... WHOA!
Oh, an English boy, eh? You know we saved your ass in World War Two.
Okay, when I call your name, ah, you say present, or here. No, say present. Anita Bath?
Hey, hey, what are you laughin' at? What? Oh, oh, I get it. I get it. It's my big ears, isn't it, kids? Isn't it? Well children, I can't help that!
That guy sure likes his fresh air. None of that for me. Oh, yeah! Yeah!
Yo-your house?! Your house? Gee, it's so glamorously decorated I thought I was in Vegas. Hey you guys lied to me! You said it was Vegas!
Hey! If you guys are getting loaded off them fumes, I'm gonna have to charge ya.
Hey, Homer, us hotheads here is gonna go tear down Burns' sun blockin' machine. You wanna come with?

Good, cause I got a hot date tonight. A date. Dinner with friends. Dinner alone. Watching TV alone. All right. I'm gonna sit at home and ogle the ladies in the Victoria's Secret catalog. Sears catalog.

No. I was the tough kid. Smelly. My shtick was looking into an exhaust pipe and gettin' a faceful of soot. Heh, nobody could do that better than me. Of course, it was kinda hard to think of reasons for me to look in that exhaust pipe every time, but you know, we had good writers. William Faulkner could write an exhaust pipe gag that would really make you think.
You stole my bit! You... That's my bit ya... Ya... ooh, ooh, you stole my bit!
Oh, it is. It is. Just, uh, pull them stools up to the pool table.
Everybody is goin' to family restaurants these days. Seems nobody wants to hang out in a dank pit no more.
Yeah. Family restaurants. That's where the big bucks are. I could turn this joint into a place where you wouldn't be ashamed to bring your family, huh?
I got it used from the Navy. You can flash-fry a buffalo in forty seconds.
If you like good food, good fun, and a whole lotta crazy crap on the walls, then come on down to "Uncle Moe's Family Feedbag."

Now that's "Moe" like it. So bring the whole family - mom, dad, kids. Uh, no old people. They're not covered by our insurance. It's fun! And remember our guarantee: If I'm not smiling when your check comes, your meal's on me, Uncle Moe.
Here ya go! Here I am! Uncle Moe! Thank ya Ma'am! This'll be a treat! Uncle Moe! Here I am! While you eat!
Nah, nah, nah. Let me level with you, Marge. That's just our name for bottom-feeding suction eel. You don't want that.
Why don't you try Moe's Hobo Chicken Chili? I start with the best part -- the neck. And then I add secret hobo spices.
I'm sorry, kid. Sorry. I'm not used to the laughter of children. It cuts through me like a dentist's drill. But no, no, that was funny, that was funny, takin' away my dignity like that. Ha ha ha.
Here ya go! Here I am! Uncle Moe! Thank ya Ma'am! This'll be a treat! Uncle Moe! Here I am! While you eat!
Aw, your "teef" hurt, huh? Your "teef" hurt? Well, that's too freakin' bad! You hear me? I'll tell you where you can put your freakin' "sodie, too!"
Aw, come on folks! Wait! Please, come back! Please! I got a new offer! Whenever Uncle Moe threatens you, you get a free steak... fish.

Man, you go through life, you try to be nice to people, you struggle to resist the urge to punch 'em in the face, and for what?! For some pimply little puke to treat you like dirt unless you're on a "team!" Well I'm better than dirt... Well, most kinds of dirt... I mean, not that fancy store-bought dirt. That stuff's loaded with nutrients. I... I can't compete with that stuff.
Yayyy! / Way to go! / The Pin Pals did it! / We won! / Team work! /
Ah, they think they're so high and mighty, just 'cause they never got caught drivin' without pants.
COME ON HOMER, COME ON HOMER / PRETEND THIS IS BASEBALL / AND HIT US A HOMER!
Yeah. Call this an unfair generalization if you must, but old people are no good at everything.
Don't worry about nothin', Homer. I have a feeling that Mr. Burns is gonna have a little accident that might keep him from bowling with us tonight. Heh, heh, heh...
Aw, he's gonna ruin everything. All right, that's it Homer! Either Burns goes or Moe goes.
You know what? We don't need him or his trophy. We got each other, huh?
Aw, the little cutie wants to do something cute... Shut up, ya bums, shut up! Go ahead, angel.
Good God. Homer, y'know I support most any prejudice you can name, but your hero-phobia sickens me. You and your daughter ain't welcome here no more. Barney, show 'em the exit.
"Evil blood-thirsty pirate"... Hello, Town Jubilation Committee? I got something that's going to make you a lot less jubilant.

Oh, so you're looking for a Mr. Smithers, eh? First name, Waylon, is it? Listen to me, you... when I catch you, I'm going to pull out your eyes and shove 'em up your pants so you can watch me kick the crap out of you. Okay? Then I'm going to use your tongue to paint my boat.
Uh, yeah, I need someone to help me with the midnight beer delivery. Your job is to distract Barney until it's safely off the truck.
Say, ah, Barn. Remember when I said I'd have to send away to NASA to calculate your bar tab?
You owe me... 70 billion dollars. No, wait, wait, wait... Oh, that's uh, for the Voyager Space Craft. Your tab's 14 billion dollars.
Come back here, you stinkin' -- Hey, I wonder how much air is in here.
Immiggants?! I knew it was them! Even when it was the bears, I knew it was them!
Ya know what really aggravazes me, is them immiggants. They want all the benefits of livin' in Springfield, but they ain't even bothered to learn themselves the language.
Fun's over, fellas. If you're gonna beat up my friend in my bar, there's a two-drink minimum.
Jeez, Homer, I never seen a guy stand up to that kinda punishment -- I mean, you took a three-man poundin' and didn't ever fall down.
There ya go! That's the spirit! Homer, I seen prizefighters couldn't take a punch half as good as you! Y'know, boxing might be right up your alley!
Aw, please, it's the good life, Homer. Some of these boxers, they eat steak and lobster and salad bar all in a single meal!
Now, Homer, if I'm gonna manage your boxing career, I wantcha to have complete faith in me. C'mere, lemme show ya somethin'...
Yeah, well, when I realized we hadn't had no ladies in here since 1979, I turned it into an office.
Yep. They called me "Kid Gorgeous." Later on, it was "Kid Presentable." Then "Kid Gruesome." And finally, "Kid Moe."
Aw, that -- that's my old spit bucket. Yeah, I been meanin' to empty that out.
Yeah, he was my manager. Back when I was gorgeous, everybody wanted a piece of me. But somehow I just never made it to the big time.
'Cause I got knocked out forty times in a row. That, plus politics. You know, it's all politics...
Okay, punching isn't your thing. But that's okay... you're not that kind of fighter. What you're gonna do is stand there while your opponent gets exhausted from overpunching.
That's right. And if the ref's not looking, you can kick him a coupla times.
Uh, no. Not yet. He still lives at the train yard. But he's a hungry young fighter. In fact, he's actually fighting for a sandwich.
Homer, I want you to have my lucky mitts. I hope you do better with 'em than I did.
Aw, that's the barbed wire. Heh. We, uh, we called that "The Stinger." They... they don't let you use that no more.
Now, no matter how much he hits you, you don't do nothin', okay? You don't wanna get drawn into a boxing match here.
Lucius! Hey, what's a glitterati like you doin' in my dump? I--I thought you were managing the Champ.
I gotta be honest with ya, Homer. I didn't bring you up here to show you my new tar-paper.
Great. All you gotta do is fight Drederick Tatum. It's this Saturday. Here's your parking pass.
Hey, hey, hey! I'm not the villain here, okay? If Homer gets killed in the ring tonight, it'll be because of your negative attitude! There, I said it.
All right, Homer, I'm not going to lie to you: there's a good chance you can beat Tatum. But you gotta visualize how you're going to win, okay?
Ah, let 'em be mad. The only thing that matters to me is, you're safe.
Well, what do dreams matter, Marge? I was able to stick up for a pal.
Okay, but the last guy who charged a drink to Burns turned up in a landfill.
Hey, hey, I may be ugly and hate-filled, but I, uh... what was the third thing you said?
Ah, ha ha, you got me, didn't ya? All right, here you go -- "Red Tick Beer."
Just a second, Homer, you gotta take a breathalyzer test before I let you drive home.
Can somebody tell me what the hell is goin' on? Midge, help me out here.

Oh, it ain't no mystery -- whole modern world got a swishifyin' effect on kids today. And their MTV's and their diet sodas ain't gonna set 'em straight neither. You gotta do it yourself, Homer. And you gotta do it fast.
Well, lessee now... uh, time was, you'd send a boy off to war. Shootin' a man'd fix him right up. But there's not even any wars no more thank you very much Warren Christopher!
Hey, he's right, Homer. After the boy bags a deer, all the diet sodas in the world won't turn him back. Then you just sit back and watch the grandkids roll in!
Remember, guys, the truck only holds six carcasses, so don't shoot nothin' but trophy bucks, huh?
C'mon, don't take it so hard, Homer. You still got that other kid... uh, Lisa. Let's take her out huntin' tomorrow, make her into a man.
Yeah, yeah, we'll never live it down. Oh, boy, it looks like it's suicide again for me.
Yeah, all right, listen up! This is the busiest drinkin' day of the year. Where are the designated drivers?
A raid?! Curly?! Um, all right, but, uh, I don't know what you... expect to find in a simple, uh, neighborhood...pet shop.
Homer! My customers are soberin' up, and they ain't gonna stay for the ambiance! You gotta get me more beer!
Look, find it, buy it, make it, I don't care. Just get me some booze, and fast!
Yeah, well listen, lady. I've got so many problems, I.... I don't even know where to begin here.
Ah, it's a weird world, Homer. As hard as it is to believe, some people don't care for me, neither.
No, it's true. I've got their names written down right here, in what I call my, uh, "enemies list".
Well, why don't you invite him over to dinner. Turn him from an enemy into a friend. Then when he's not expecting it, bam! The old fork in the eye.
Hey, I don't need no advice from no pinball machine. I'll have you know I wrote the book on love.
"Go near Moe." I'd say that's a pretty strong endorsement. So, how about you and me go out sometime? You know, out back.
Sorry, Grampa, but I gotta stash you in the bathroom so Betty won't get wise to us.
You know what's great about you, Betty, is you're letting your looks go gracefully. You're not all hung up on looking "attractive" and "desirable". It's just so rare and refreshing.
Myself? Oh, geez. Um, I gotta go to the can again. I got the runs.

Um, ah, oh, g... I might as well come clean with ya. I ain't too good at talking to women, and... and I really wanted to do ya, so I brought along the love tester to help me. As you may have guessed, it's inhabited by the ghost of my friend's dead father.
Yeah, all right. Listen up, guys. The Springfield Police have told me that 91 per cent of all traffic accidents are caused by you six guys.
Yeah, I know, I know. But the bad news is we gotta start having designated drivers.
Everybody reach in and draw a pickled egg. Whoever gets the black egg stays sober tonight.
Yeah so, last night I was closing up the bar, when some young punk comes in and tries to stick me up.
Well, it coulda been a real ugly situation, but I managed to shoot him in the spine.
And that's how, with a few minor adjustments, you can turn a regular gun into five guns.
Ah, sorry Homer, I've been planning this vacation for years. I'm finally gonna see Easter Island.
Oh, no? Well if you're so sure what it ain't, how 'bout tellin' us what it am?
Geez, this hot-rod is souped up six ways from Sunday. Never had you figured for a gear-head, Homer.
What? No. Why? What? Why? What have you heard? Are you implyin' I'm in some sort of financial trouble?
Sounds like you're having a rough Christmas, Homer. You know what I blame this on the breakdown of? Society.
Hey, listen up, everybody! The Simpsons are the best friends I ever had. So I'm givin' them the tip jar from the bar!
Well, we hated being mad at ya, Homer, so we decided to make things right.
Hey, I'll give you something to cry about, ya loser! You can't catch a football?! Let's see if you can catch a rock!
Dammit, it fell apart like everything else I've ever believed in. Oh, I guess it's back to good old fashioned voodoo.
Hi. How you folks doin'? I'm Moe. Or as the ladies like to call me, "Hey you, behind the bushes." Uh, is this thing on?
...the last angry clown, the man who spews truth from every orifice, ladies and gentlemen... Krusty!
Yeah. Big deal. You got a wife. I got a rash. Who cares? Ech, I'm sorry, Homer. It's just, it's been four years since my last date with a whatchacallit, uh, woman.
Ah, she got homesick for her old life, diving for tourist pennies in a Micronesian swamp.
Yeah, I don't blame her. No girl wants to end up with a Joe Puke-pail like me.
Yeah, well, uh, how come I ain't fendin' off movie starlets with a pointy stick?
Ah, I don't know, Homer. Women can smell panic. And, uh, right now, I gotta be reekin' of it.
All right, come on, what's the catch? A gorgeous woman don't just hand ya a free daffydil.
Yeah, well, the part that's showin'. I guess you could have a lot of weird scars, or a fake ass, or somethin'.
Well... no... no... well... no... not a... lot... I... Gee, I'm sorry. I used to box you know, my brain's... Well, it's in and out.
Yeah, I... look, I don't suppose... you'd never want to... uh... I dunno... get together sometime?
Ah, what was I thinkin'? A beautiful girl like you and a gargoyle like me. I... I-I'm sorry.
Really? Hot damn! All right. Don't eat nothin' for the next three days, 'cause I'm takin' you out for a steak the size of a toilet seat!
Hey! Hey! Sabu! Ah, I need another magnum of your best champagne, here, uh? And bring us the finest food you got, stuffed with the second finest.
Yeahhh, well, I just get so tired of idiots shootin' their mouths off, laughin' and clappin'. Makes you wanna start pokin' eyes out and slashin' guts and kickin' throats...
Uh, yeah, park the dessert cart under this beautiful lady's nose. And charge it all to my Players Club card.
Yeah, I wanna send her two dozen roses. And I wanna put something nice on the card, like, um, "Renee, my treasure..."

Shut up, or I'll ram a stool down your throat! Ah, nah, nah, no, I don't want that on the card... Well, lemme hear how it sounds... Nah, nah, take it out. Take it out. And charge it to my Players Club card... Maxed out?
Look, I really need these flowers, okay? I got a real tenuous hold on my girlfriend here... Hello? Hello?
Well, that's it. It's all over. Renee ain't gonna wanna hang around with no Joe Pinchpenny.
Hmmm... I need cash, and lots of it. Um, all right, everybody, I'm calling in your bar tabs.
Nah, my car ain't worth nothin'. But it is insured... For five grand... Homer, I need your help. You gotta steal this car and wreck it for me.
C'mon, Homer! I'm one of your dearest friends! When everybody said you were too drunk to drive that time, who gave you your keys?
Okay, here's the plan. This model car represents my car, huh? And this olive is you. Now...
Hey! Hey! Aw, that's great. Now the car's gonna have to represent you, and, uh, this little toy man will represent the car.
Listen up, here. Tomorrow night at eight, you go down to the waterfront and you "steal" my car.
That's the beauty part. Every cop in town's gonna be on the Police Department's Moonlight Charity Cruise. And I'm gonna be right there with 'em.
Righ-- No, no. Wrong. Listen. While I'm on the boat with the perfect alibi, you steal my car, and park it on the railroad tracks. Then when the 10:15 train comes along...
WHAM! The insurance company pays off five thousand clams. I keep showing Renee the sweet life.
Ah, 'scuse me there, officer? You see my car there? With the rubber hippie daisy? Space 7A?
The train! D'you hear that? That's the train! Ha! Isn't that the most beautiful sound you ever heard?
Hey! Hey, what's it doin' there? It was supposed to be on the railroad tracks -- no, I mean... the parking lot.
Yeah, I wish I could, Homer, but if I change my story, they're gonna throw me in here.
Ohh, cripes, the puppy-dog look. All right, all right. I'll use the money to bail you out.
Naw, naw, naw, we're goin' for the real thing. First class all the way. Come on, we can leave tonight.
... So like a coward I let Homer take the rap for the whole scam. And now the only way to clear him is to turn myself in.
Yeah, that's true. That's true, baby. Hmf, it'll be hell being locked away from ya, but I guess I gotta take my medicine. Unless... Unless, I send a letter to the police clearing Homer...
We-we-we switch clothes with them, leave 'em in the bar. Then we pour some brandy around. Like so...
Well, I'm not gonna let anything happen to my two best customers. I'm joining too.
So Lenny, let's say you pull a thorn out of the Pope's butt and he grants ya one wish. What'll it be?
Eh, gee, I was gonna say a night with Joey Heatherton. But an ironed shirt... Damn! That's tempting.
Ah, gee, you're kinda all over the place there, Homer. You need to focus here. You gotta think hard and come up with a slogan that appeals to all the lazy slobs out there.
Ooh. Yeah. And then what happened? Omit no detail, no matter how small or filthy.
Okay, I think we've been polite long enough here. Lenny, what happened with the dame and the bathing suit?
Oh, God. You smokers disgust me. Hey 'Pu, you got a breakfast cereal for people with syphilis?
So, I round the corner and head down the ointment aisle, when who should I spot? None other than Kent Brockman!
Nah. Nah. Just, uh, hop that fence, sneak up and, uh, peek in the window there.
Well, I gotta hand it to you, Homer. You're really brave to go through with this operation.
Nah, nah, no. Makin' polenta, that's a procedure. You're talkin' about deadly, life-threatening surgery, here.
Listen, I'm just gonna get right to the point, here. Can I have your buttocks? I mean, if you die. They look pretty comfortable.
Hey Homer, I told you not to come 'round here no more till you paid your tab. Or at least cleaned up that mess you made in the bathroom. Now y--
Shove off, puke-holes. Get out of there! These stools are reserved for the mayor and his cronies.
Bye weeks. Bronco Nagurski didn't get no bye weeks. And now he's dead. Well, maybe they're a good thing.
Oh, absolutely. My favorite team's in it: the Atlanta Falcons . Yeah, ever since I was a boy, I've always loved the Atlanta Falcons .
Hey Homer, we been runnin' around cheerin' for an hour. Where the hell's the game?
Ah man, he's makin' us look like a bunch of cheapskates. Whoa whoa. My rope came loose.
Ah, remember, Midge. You feel the need to rage, you call me, right? I won't even get sexual or nothin'. Unless that's what you want. That, that's not what you want, right?

Groundskeeper Willie, you know the guy in the skirt? He bought himself a mail-order bride, but he was too cheap to pay the C.O.D., right? So she's still in a crate down at the post office! Wanna go look-see?
Yeah, yeah, I been meanin' to wash that, but, uh, you know, it's been such a century...
But it's me, Moe, wearing a sailor suit. Moe -- with a lolly. It's so out of character. Ain't that worth nothin'?
"You have been chosen to join the Justice Squadron! 8 a.m. Monday at the Municipal Fortress of Vengeance." Oh, I am so there!
Yeah, thanks. It's just past the end of the bar, next to the heavyset guy.
All right, take it easy. Take it easy. I'm just saying you ain't no, uh, Tommy Tune.
Hey, a duel? I, ah-- Isn't that a little extreme? Here, here, have a free beer.
Geez, Homer. I never seen you so depressed. As your life partner, I'm very worried.
I'm a little worried. He usually stops in for an eye-opener on the way to work.
Wow. Anyway, you don't think he could be at another bar, do you? Because I couldn't take that! I... uh... I-I just couldn't! I...
Now, you know I can't sell you no beer till two P.M., on accounta it's Sunday.
Sorry. Two P.M. Or you can steal a boat and sail out to International Waters.
